title: Do you think that the elevator is a good invention? And why? - Quora

response.answer_text: Of course. It’s made possible the modern city, the most powerful engine of commerce ever invented. It’s allowed us to concentrate populations, which created the economic conditions needed to for brick-and-mortar retailing, for museums, for theaters, for professional sports, and for all the other goodies big cities have. Elevators were simultaneously an obvious technical advance—over baskets on ropes that were hauled up and dropped down from second and third stories. They were also a work of genius, which have changed the way human beings live, largely for the better. A good invention? Damn right.

Sure, it’s a great invention. I mean, if a building has like 200 floors and I need to get to the top floor in less than five minutes, I don’t know how I’d do it without an elevator. Unless I somehow have super powers I don’t know about yet.
Without an elevator, so-called high rise building would need to rely purely on staircases for people and materials to get to higher floors, thus limiting the height of buildings.
